Calculate Maximums and Minimums of Performance Metrics

calculate.max.min.Rd

This function calculates the maximum and minimum values for wins, ties, and losses from a given results data frame. It identifies which method achieved these values.

calculate.max.min(res)

Arguments

res

A data frame containing performance metrics. It must include the following columns:

  • method: Names of the methods.

  • win: Count of wins for each method.

  • tie: Count of ties for each method.

  • loss: Count of losses for each method.

Value

A data frame with the following columns:

Category

The category of the metric (e.g., Max Win, Min Win, etc.).

Method

The method corresponding to the maximum or minimum value in the respective category.

Value

The maximum or minimum value for the respective category.

Examples

# Example usage
results_df <- data.frame(
  method = c("Method A", "Method B", "Method C"),
  win = c(5, 3, 8),
  tie = c(2, 1, 4),
  loss = c(1, 0, 2)
)
calculate.max.min(results_df)
#> Error in calculate.max.min(results_df): could not find function "calculate.max.min"
